p: Territory of Washington County of Spokane} In the District Court of the 4th Judicial district holding terms at county seat of Spokane County Territory of Washington vs. Ray Raymond Defendant Territory of Washington County of Spokane W.T. Ray Raymond being first fuly sworn on my oath state: I am defendant above named and I am not guilty of the crime with which I am charged in this indictment nor of any offense therein contained against the laws of Washington Territory. I believe I cannot have a fair trial of this cause in the county of Spokane on account of and owing to the prejudice and excitement against me in and among the inhabitants of said County, and I ask to be tried by disconnected triers. That among the facts upon which such belief is founded I state the following: I have a number of bitter personal enemies in the city of Spokane Falls in said County, whom am informed and believe, and upon such information and belief allege have ever since I was accused of this crime busied themselves industriously circulating false statements purporting to be the facts retolding to this case and also in circulating rumor and false to the effect that I am a dangerous and quarrelsome attention and given to the wonton and reckless use of firearms, and so persistently has this statement been made that many give people of the county have come to believe it and to repeat it as true; that many false and, malicious statement and charges against this defendant have been circulated among the inhabitant of said county among which I am informed and believe, and upon that information and belief alleges that since I was at land of the crime it has been circulated among and is generally believed by the people of the county, that I had therefore murdered my husband and had killed two men & oen woman in matters are of which are wholly false but have tended greatly to excite any prejudice the people of the court, against and that many false and exagerated and highly covered and prejudicial account, purporting to be the facts in this case have been invented among the people of the court among other false and untrue statements purporting to be the facts in this case circulated since I was accused of this crime was is the following I am informed and believe, and upon such information and belief allege that me George Turner, who appearing no a special provention against me at the hearing of the habeas corpus application to admit me to bail heard before this court affront the thing of such having stated That the prosecution had witnesses to prove that at the time of the killing with which I am charged the deceased was in the hallway of the "Bay Window" house said derive him did fix him and thrusting the revolver in his throat fixed the shot that killed him applicant here states politely that such statement of the facts in this and is wholly untrue and alleges upon her information and belief that the prosecution never at any time had any person who cover & swear his wavy part of it many thing assembling it applicant is further informed and believes that this story was commendated among the people of this county until many good people came to believe it to be the true statement of facts in the case, and am greatly purporting against defendant by name thereof that whether or not said special prosecutor was employed against defendant volunteered to prosecute for applicant does not know but applicant has been informed and believes that citizens of Spokane Falls attempted to employ special council to be aid in her prosecution. Applicant further statesthat during the time of the preliminary hearing of this case before justices Peel and Booge she heard many expressions of bitter prejudice against her from among the crowd of people in attendance and heard the crowd stomp their feet in approval of the final determination of such hearing justices in holding defendant for murder in the first degree without bail and during said hearing refused many strong manifestations of prejudice and excitement against her and was became alarmed for her own safety, applicant has heard and the affidavit of her attorney Thomas C. Griffitts heaving and knows many of the facts therin stated concerning the recurances at the preliminary hearing before said Justices of her own knowledge, and concerning the publications in the newspaper therin referred to and knows such statement to be true and she reported said affidavit and to the affidavit of her other comments herein filed and to the other affidavit filed in support of this justice force were specific statement of the facts and circumstances upon which she bases her belief in the prejudice of the people I have stated the facts and titleing my defenses herin truly and fully to my council in this cause and am among by there that I have a good defense and me that can be made available herein if I can have a fair trial; that this application is not made for delay but in good faith and that Justice may be one. Ray Raymond Subscribed and sworn to before me this 2nd day of Dec. 1886 J. Kennedy Stout Notary Public Wash. Terr.
